meanings.definition: To hang on a gibbet as a warning or punishment.
meanings.sent1: The pirate was gibbeted for all to see.
meanings.sent2: The authorities gibbeted the thief to deter others from crime.
meanings.sent3: The town gibbeted the litterbug to discourage littering.
meanings.sent4: The teacher gibbeted the student's bad behavior in front of the class.
meanings.sent5: The king gibbeted the traitor to send a strong message to his subjects.

meanings.definition: A structure used for displaying the bodies of executed criminals.
meanings.sent1: The old gibbet stood as a grim reminder of past executions.
meanings.sent2: Visitors to the museum were shocked by the sight of the gibbet.
meanings.sent3: The children played pretend, pretending the jungle gym was a gibbet.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building loomed over the town like a gibbet of the past.
meanings.sent5: The artist's sculpture resembled a modern gibbet, evoking a sense of dread.
